results.title: The Good food show. series 2
results.brief_description: Gabrielle Gate takes us through a series of episodes which focus not only on good eating, but good health also. The emphasis is on freshness, quality and the excellence of Australian produce. Guest chefs appear on the programs to offer the viewers a range of delicious recipes and ideas. The programs on this tape are: Fishy tales; The Humble spud; Sweet temptations and Something special.

results.title: The Good Food Cookbook
results.brief_description: The Good Food Cookbook will not only show you how to master all those cooking techniques which recipes never seem to explain, but also give you hundreds of practical tips and hints so that you can both buy, prepare and cook food so much more easily and enjoyably. Rated: G

results.title: The Good Fight
results.creator_credit: Sam Sills, Mary Dore and Noel Buckner
results.brief_description: An excellent political documentary about more than three thousand Americans who joined the Abraham Lincoln Brigade to fight in the Spanish Civil War from 1936-1939, although their participation was frowned upon in many quarters in America at the time. Newsreel clips, anecdotes from veterans, and a Hollywood film, “Blockade”, are deftly edited together to produce this valuable ennobling history lesson. Rated: G

results.title: The Good Fight
results.creator_credit: Citt Williams, Beck Cole and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
The good fight is a documentary film about masculinity in a modern world, spirituality and the lore of the boxing ring. Set in Dulwich Hill, Sydney’s inner west, the film delves into the gritty existence of a local ‘Fight Club’ led by an unlikely character, Rev. Dave Smith. The story evolves around Rev. Dave’s relationships with the young people who frequent the Fight Club. Includes interviews with Jared Tekaki, Craig (Shorty) Sutton, Shaun Joyce and Alex Tui.
Contains some b&w images.

results.title: The Good Fight
results.brief_description: Picking up one year after the events of the final broadcast episode of “The Good Wife”, an enormous financial scam has destroyed the reputation of a young lawyer, Maia Rindell, while simultaneously wiping out her mentor and godmother Diane Lockhart’s savings. Forced out of her law firm, now called “Lockhart, Deckler, Gussman, Lee, Lyman, Gilbert, Lurie, Kagan, Tannebaum & Associates”, they join Lucca Quinn at one of Chicago’s preeminent law firms.

results.title: The Good Earth
results.creator_credit: Sidney A. Franklin, Irving G. Thalberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Set in pre-revolutionary China, Paul Muni plays Wang Lung, a simple peasant farmer who rises to become a prosperous lord. Tragedy pursues him as he betrays his family and neglects the earth he has worshipped. Luise Rainer won an Academy Award for her portrayal of O-Lan, Wang’s devoted wife, a battered slave who grows into a proud, loyal woman. Based on Pearl S. Buck’s Pulitzer Prize winning novel.

results.title: The Gondoliers, or, The King of Barataria
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, March 2, 1989 this operetta by Gilbert and Sullivan is considered one of the best Savoy Operas. Marco and Giuseppe Palmien are two Venetian gondoliers, one of whom is also the rightful King of Barataria, since no-one knows which of them is the rightful King, they both have a chance to put their republican principles into practice by sharing the throne. But it is then revealed that in fact neither of them is truly the king. This operetta satirises republican principles and the libretto has been modified to contain present-day references. Performed by The Australian Opera Chorus and The Elizabethan Philharmonic Orchestra. Performers include: Stephen Bennett, Jeffrey Black, Gillian Sullivan, Donald Shanks, David Hobson. The Australian Opera Chorus conducted by Gyorgy Fischer. Recorded as part of Esso night at the opera.

results.title: The Gondoliers or the King of Barataria
results.creator_credit: Dave Heather and Judith de Paul
results.brief_description: Marco and Guiseppe Palmien are two Venetian gondoliers, one of whom is also the rightful King of Barataria. Since no one knows which of them was abducted from the kingdom as a child, they have a chance to put their republican principles into practice by sharing the throne … until it is revealed that in fact neither of them is truly king. Performers include: Keith Michell, Eric Shilling, Francis Edgerton, Tom Mc Donnell, Nan Christie, Anne Collins, Sandra Dugdale. The London Symphony Orchestra (London) conducted by Alexander Faris. John McCarthy (Chorus Master), Ambrosian Opera Chorus. Staged by Peter Wood. Introduced by Douglas Fairbanks Jnr.
